content.webTitle: Freed Christian convert offered asylum in Italy

fields.headline: Freed Christian convert offered asylum in Italy
fields.bodyText: The Afghan man threatened with death for refusing to renounce his Christian beliefs has been freed from prison, after international pressure on Kabul, and is seeking asylum. Abdul Rahman, 41, had been due to go on trial for apostasy - abandonment of faith - a crime punishable by death but on Monday the courts dropped the case, saying he was mentally ill. Mr Rahman, who has been offered asylum by Italy, said he was fine and willing to die for his faith. Several Muslim clerics threatened to have him killed on his release, and street protests are expected against the ruling.
